author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: ‘Why in the World’ in Palermo
text:
‘Why in the World’ in Palermo Oct 20, 2015 A documentary about chemtrails is the Friday Movie Night pick Oct. 30 in Palermo. 
Palermo — "Why in the World Are They Spraying?" (2012, USA) will be screened Friday night, Oct. 30, at the Palermo Community Center, Veterans Way off Turner Ridge Road. The documentary will be shown following the 6 p.m. free potluck dinner; the public is welcome to come for the meal or just the screening. 
“Why in the World are They Spraying?” is an investigation into one of the many agendas associated with chemtrail/geoengineering programs — i.e., weather control. In this follow-up to 2010’s “What in the World are They Spraying?”, director Michael J. Murphy expands upon the story of a rapidly developing industry driven by scientists, corporations and governments intent on changing global climate, controlling the weather and altering the chemical composition of soil and water — all supposedly for the betterment of mankind. 
For more information or directions, call 993-2294. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
